column4: Hey all, im having issues getting Xchat to start up minimized to systray, i got a little bash script that runs which is just 'xchat minimize=2' (excluding quotes)...the application loads on startup but doesn't appear in systray and i can't see that its running unless i view with top
i was thinking there was an extra xchat package to add the min to systray feature.
does that command work from a terminal?
yep it does - works from the terminal
you could make it  'sleep 10' from the script. so it waits a bit befor starting. It may be the gnome desktop is not fully setup when the script runs.
dont merge them like that perhaps.. do each on own line. sleep 10     then 'xchat &'
try it without.. and with.. learn bash job control basics. :)
It didn't make a difference :( still doesnt load the ts3 server
its a meta-key (aka the super key) its  used by many many other apps as that sort of a key. remaping it may goof up a lot of things.
theres tools like guake,  that can scroll down a terminal with differnt key combos
a meta-key? Ive never had no use for it yet?
compiz and  unity make use of it for a great many things...
ahh ok, shall i leave it then?
i use it in unity, and for compiz featutres all the time. :) even in windows  it has special features these days
